meanings.definition: Relating to observable characteristics of an organism resulting from the interaction of its genotype with the environment.
meanings.sent1: The phenotypic differences between the two siblings were noticeable.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the phenotypic traits of plants to understand their growth patterns.
meanings.sent3: The phenotypic variations in the fruit made it look like a colorful puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Her artistic talent was a phenotypic marvel, reflecting her unique genetic makeup.
meanings.sent5: The phenotypic changes in the butterfly's wings were truly breathtaking.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the physical appearance or traits of an organism.
meanings.sent1: The phenotypic characteristics of the bird made it easy to identify.
meanings.sent2: The zookeeper noted the phenotypic similarities between the two tiger cubs.
meanings.sent3: The phenotypic features of the flower garden were a delight to behold.
meanings.sent4: His phenotypic resemblance to his grandfather was striking.
meanings.sent5: The phenotypic diversity of the fish in the aquarium was fascinating to observe.
